alert.note: Alert for Lee; Ogle; Winnebago (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 8:06PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow will impact portions of Ogle, northwestern Lee and Winnebago Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 802 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary out ahead of a cluster of thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Durand to near Pecatonica to near Milledgeville. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Automated Weather Station at Freeport Airport recorded a wind gust near 40 mph near 8 PM CDT. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rockford, Beloit, Loves Park, Machesney Park, Dixon, Roscoe, South Beloit, Rockton, Byron, Oregon, Mount Morris, Polo, Rockford Airport, Cherry Valley, Winnebago, Davis Junction, Pecatonica, Forreston, Durand and Stillman Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
